programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. An American acquaintance of Lovejoy's is sold some fake antiques, so he sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible - and make a little money into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.desc: Dom's life is hanging in the balance, while Hanssen questions whether he did the right thing. programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents attend an eye-opening house-warming party as Dan Ferreira welcomes his guests to 'Graceland'

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: The policeman accompanies climbers on a hill trek, but they find themselves in trouble after ignoring his warnings. Robert Carlyle stars

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When a man who arranged to meet Lovejoy at the local cricket game dies suddenly, it falls to the antiques dealer to find the fortune that was promised to the widow. The unusual legacy includes a forged snuff box. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dawn rushes to be by Andrew's side as he hovers near death, while Sam is tormented by the thought that he could have done more to help his stricken colleague. Joanna wrestles with a medical dilemma as her teenage patient recoils from the prospect of undergoing the risky operation to remove her brain tumour. Starring Gary Mavers, Joseph Millson and Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec and Zoe cannot believe their luck as everything in their life seems to be going right for once - until an unexpected house guest shatters the peace. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers, Lesley Dunlop and Carolyn Pickles

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Davies is saddened by the death of a harmless local tramp known for his penchant for collecting waste paper in a pram. The detective's instincts, along with the intervention of social services officer Jemma Duval, lead him to pursue the case, uncovering a wartime mystery along the way. Norman Wisdom stars alongside Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Sasha is occupied with a training course, the boys' investigations take them to a lookalike agency, where their top two acts were found dead in an apparent double suicide 13 years ago. In an industry reliant on the art of the illusion and their suspects intent on giving them the run around, Ted, Steve and Danny are convinced there's more to this case than first meets the eye. Steve is thrilled when their enquiries take them to the door of one of his football heroes, but his glee is short-lived. Detective drama, starring Denis Lawson

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called to the scene of a drive-by shooting, but the case proves less clear-cut than expected when evidence emerges that someone returned fire. The vehicle used is soon traced to an abandoned industrial unit, where a decomposing corpse is uncovered - and Nikki resolves to find out the true cause of death. Guest starring Craig Kelly and Freema Agyeman

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Lyle helps horse trainer Herb Griffiths lease a field for his prize racer Market Mischief, but finds his loyalties tested when travellers take up residence there and are then accused of stealing the racehorse. Peter has been instructed by his client Mrs Collins to file for divorce from her cross-dressing husband, but the optimistic solicitor believes a reconciliation is possible with his intervention. Hill returns to seek payment on Simon's debt. Robert Bathurst guests

programme.desc: Alec hires an au pair when he thinks Zoe is overdoing things. Romantic comedy, starring Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Roy Barraclough guest stars as Crowcroft, a well-known Lothario with a preference for gullible women. When he samples Nora Batty's baking, he decides to make her his next target. Long-running comedy, with Kathy Staff, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The apparently motiveless murder of an American tourist found battered to death brings Dalziel back in contact with an old flame. Evidence leads the detective duo to a rough pub just outside Thorpburgh, where they discover a photograph of the murdered woman pictured with two soldiers. David Soul, Phyllis Logan and Lee Boardman guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team pursues a serial killer with a grisly desire to look at his victims' faces as they die, and the trail leads into the world of academic philosophy. However, Nikki is distracted from the case by the death of her grandmother, while Harry investigates the demise of a woman who apparently drowned in three inches of water

programme.title: Damilola, Our Loved Boy
programme.desc: In November 2000, 10-year-old schoolboy Damilola Taylor was attacked and fatally wounded in Peckham, south London, a death that shocked the nation. This feature-length drama reveals the personal stories behind the headlines, exploring Damilola's journey from Lagos to London, and showing how Richard and Gloria Taylor coped with their personal lives as well as the pressure of the media as they fought for justice for the killing of their son. Babou Ceesay, Wunmi Mosaku and Sammy Kamara star, with Robert Pugh

programme.desc: Polish concentration camp survivor John Narbutowicz (Joss Ackland) seeks Peter's help when the council insists on entering his home to clear it of rubbish. Beatrice hopes to bond with Gloria and ropes her in on a girls' day out. Meanwhile, Snell has a dream that sets him off on an adventure, and Mrs Thing is persuaded to leave her money to the church. Rory Bremner guest stars as the local vicar

programme.title: The Coroner

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The penultimate episode sees the retired detectives investigating possibly their most difficult cold case yet. A bloodstained bust is uncovered during construction work in a cemetery and the evidence points to the murder of an alternative-medicine practitioner seven years earlier. Further clues lead to the controversial world of cryopreservation - the practice of keeping clinically dead patients frozen to extend their life cycle. Sasha is determined they don't put a foot wrong - but with the sobering possibility that two perpetrators are still at large, the detectives are forced to go out on a limb

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki investigates a man's apparent suicide and begins to suspect foul play after two more deaths occur, leading to recently released mental patient David Nicholson being accused of their murder. While the doctor treating Nicholson is adamant that he is no threat to anyone, the pathologists are not convinced - especially when a connection with the original victim emerges

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: As spring arrives, Nonnatus House welcomes two new nuns, the experienced Sister Hilda and newly qualified Sister Frances, who must acclimatise to the changing East End. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.desc: David Harewood delivers the 2023 Richard Dimbleby Lecture on the 75th anniversary of Empire Windrush arriving in the UK. Introduced by Jonathan Dimbleby, from London's Battersea Arts Centre

programme.desc: Phil ropes Ritchie in to dig up dirt on George's missing wife and Suki convinces Nish they need to sack Eve. Keanu realises Finlay's car was deliberately damaged and Ben backtracks on having Lexi live with him

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team mark National Windrush Day by restoring items that celebrate the Windrush generation. Beverley comes into the barn with a British passport issued to her father in Jamaica in 1948 which served as his legally binding document to come to the UK to help rebuild after the Second World War. Keithly brings in a suitcase used by his mother that holds memories of her journey from the island of Nevis to the UK in 1956. Brother and sister duo Dorcas and Stephan bring a precious clock for the attention of horologist Steven Fletcher, it being the first item their parents Hermann and Keturah saved up to buy after arriving in the UK from Antigua. Patrick Vernon OBE brings with him his British-Jamaican Second World War veteran father's radiogram for repair

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: The gang try to pinpoint where it all started and what went wrong. Georgia spies an opportunity as both David and Michael worry the other prefers working alone

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael try to break the standstill on the project while Simon tries becoming a dentist after giving up writing. Georgia's efforts turn manipulative

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Telford, Shropshire, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull set out to design a cat friendly 'enchanted' garden. Lesley would love an enchanted space suitable for her beloved cat Gizmo to share with her, and importantly, her very own outdoor gin bar to relax with her friends. She has 3,500 to spare, hoping Charlie and Chris can make her dreams come true.

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team is in Bedford to help a family-of-six bursting at the seams. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to turn a dining room into a much-needed bedroom. The helpers also create an area for the family to eat, transforming an old utility space into a breakfast bar

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman explore St George's Market in Belfast and meet a social media sensation who reveals the secrets of healthy and inexpensive one-pot meals. Farmer Jim Smith discovers how one farm is turning its oats into milk, and food journalist Leyla Kazim is in Norfolk to find out the secrets of producing mustard, while farmer Meinir Howells reveals just why Welsh lamb is so popular

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey at Liverpool's historic waterfront, where he visits the International Slavery Museum at Royal Albert Dock, before heading underground to discover one of the most important and secret rooms of the Second World War, the Royal Navy's Western Approaches Headquarters. His next stop is Crosby on the Merseyside coastline in Sefton, before making his way north to Blackpool, the last stop on this leg of his journey

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day one of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring matches from the first round. Matteo Berrettini has won this title and each of the last two years and returns in a bid to complete a hat-trick. However, he will face tough competition from the likes of British stars Andy Murray, Cameron Norrie and Dan Evans, world number one Carlos Alcaraz and the in-form Holger Rune

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of his youth, starting at Preston's Fulwood Barracks and heading to Bury Bolton Street Station in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fourth day of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. Australia ended an eight-match unbeaten Test run against all opposition for the hosts at this venue with a 251-run triumph here in 2019. England then went on to lose to New Zealand in their next Test here in 2021, but they did end that losing run with a seven-wicket win against India last year

programme.title: Your Body Uncovered with Kate Garraway
programme.desc: Kate and Dr Guddi Singh meet people with everyday medical conditions and take them through immersive consultations to help better understand their illnesses. In the first episode, Kate and Guddi meet Hilda, a fashion influencer suffering from fibroids, who confronts her debilitating condition, as well as grandmother Trudi struggling with a frozen shoulder

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how after decades of violence a breakthrough was reached in the form of the Good Friday Agreement in 1998, after years of talks at government level and with the intervention of US president Bill Clinton. The programme also examines the legacy of the Troubles, with its effects on victims and survivors being lasting and significant

programme.title: Glastonbury Anthems
programme.desc: A selection of classic songs performed at Worthy Farm over the years of the festival, with this edition featuring appearances by Radiohead, Robbie Williams and Blondie

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at how Czech-born Martina Navratilova began to dominate Wimbledon in the 1980s, but struggled to be as adored as her big US rival Chris Evert. At the heart of this story is Navratilova's search for acceptance, which culminated in an ambition to become the greatest player to ever grace Centre Court

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity (2015)
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneering Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kim rallies the troops for a surprise Ofsted inspection and Joe's day goes from bad to worse while the whole school is watching. Danny helps with the school knife crime initiative and Kai comes to Nicky's aid when she finds herself caught up with the wrong people

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at three unique houses in the North East of England that together tell a story of wealth, industry and art in Northumbria. One of the properties is Cragside, an awe-inspiring Victorian mansion, perched in woodland on the edge of a Northumberland moor. It's the Victorian era's ultimate trophy home, built by one of its wealthiest industrialists - William Armstrong

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day two of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring matches from the second round. There were mixed fortunes for British players in round one last year, with wild card Ryan Peniston causing an upset when he defeated top seed Casper Ruud 7-6, 7-6, but 2021 runner-up Cameron Norrie was beaten 6-7, 6-1, 6-4 by Grigor Dimitrov, and Dan Evans lost 6-3, 6-3 to reigning champion Matteo Berrettini

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: On day two, former victors Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker hope they have what it takes to win, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey reaches Greater Manchester, where he celebrates new beginnings for the nation in the years after the Second World War. At Trafford General Hospital, he investigates the birth of the National Health Service. A retired physiotherapist recalls her part in the historic event of July 5, 1948. Coronation Star tells Michael about the first episode of the soap, broadcast live in 1960. And at the city's Science and Industry Museum, the presenter encounters a replica of the Baby, which was created in 1948 - the first machine in the world to run a stored program and the forerunner of all modern computers

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fifth and final day of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. Australia's Steven Smith was in imperious form when the sides last met here in this format in 2019, scoring 144 in the first innings and 142 in the second as his team recorded an emphatic 251-run victory

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon presents the property makeover show in which cutting-edge virtual reality and visual effects enable people to see what their home could look like, before it is built in reality. Architects Will Foster and Julian McIntosh compete to remodel Yesim and Hasan's 1920s semi-detached house in Enfield, north London. The couple have had the house four years, but despite major renovation they have not managed to inject their personality into it and are struggling with a disconnected layout

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: The energy and ambition of young creatives in Nigeria, asking what drives their success in everything from music to film-making. Afua meets Ayobami Adebayo, award-winning author and rising star of the Lagos literary scene. She also discovers how designer Adeju Thompson is blazing a trail with his non-binary clothes label Lagos Space Programme, cooks giant snails with Nigerian chef Obehi Ekhomu-El Herfi and talks African music with singer Md Kuti - the grandson of Afrobeat legend Fela Kuti

programme.title: Glastonbury Anthems
programme.desc: Another selection of classic songs performed over the years at the festival, this time featuring Amy Winehouse, Jay-Z and Neil Diamond

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Victoria Derbyshire analyses the day's headline news stories

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Gloria Bell (2018)
programme.desc: A free-spirited fiftysomething divorcee seeks romance at Los Angeles dance clubs. and finds herself thrust into an unexpected new relationship, filled with the joys of budding love and the complications of dating. Comedy drama, starring Julianne Moore, John Turturro and Michael Cera

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The stories of beat coppers who stumble upon a key piece of evidence and bring a major criminal to justice. A car running a red light leads officers into a chase with an armed criminal, and a suspicious death leads to the discovery of a deadly poison plot. Presented by Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Little Richard: King and Queen of Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: The life and career of the pioneering musician, a black artist who grew up in the segregated American South, broke down barriers and took 1950s America by storm. The Beatles and the Rolling Stones supported him and took inspiration from his musicianship and stagecraft, and he went on to influence artists as diverse as David Bowie, Elton John, Michael Jackson and Prince. Featuring interviews with Ringo Starr, Keith Richards, Nile Rodgers and Big Freedia, as well as contributions from friends, bandmates and Little Richard himself, this feature-length documentary tells the story of a rollercoaster life

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day three of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the opening second-round singles matches. Eventual runner-up Filip Krajinovic came back from a set down to overcome experienced qualifier Sam Querrey at this stage last year, and two-time champion Marin Cilic prevailed in straight sets against Alexander Bublik. There was also a victory for Great Britain's Ryan Peniston against Francisco Cerundolo, but the other remaining home player, Jack Draper, lost out to Emil Ruusuvuori

programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by tram to the former cotton town of Oldham on the edge of the Peak District. Here he visits Oldham Coliseum, the town's Victorian repertory theatre, and hears about the lifting of censorship by the Lord Chamberlain's Office in the late 1960s. He then goes hiking before a visit to Sheffield, where he attends a knife-making workshop. He ends this part of his journey admiring the striking post-war sculptures of Barbara Hepworth at the Yorkshire Sculpture Park near Wakefield

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace heads to Coventry to pay a visit the biggest tortilla factory in Europe, which makes 60,000 tonnes of snacks every year. Here, he follows the production of their UK bestseller, the 150g sharing bag of chilli heatwave flavour tortilla chips. Elsewhere, Cherry Healy visits the UK's largest chilli farm where her tastebuds take on the hottest chilli in the world

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets off down the river Spey, Scotland's third longest river, encountering golden eagles, a Jacobite fugitive, lumberjacks, and salmon fishers along the way

programme.title: There She Goes
programme.desc: One-off return of the comedy drama about a family with a learning disabled daughter. Rosie is now 13 and is starting to display increasingly challenging, emotional and physical behaviour. She veers wildly from a joyous obsession with the letter X to sudden violent outbursts. But then the family realise Rosie is simply struggling to cope with the onset of puberty like any other teenage girl. Starring David Tennant, Jessica Hynes and Miley Locke

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Hero: The Extraordinary Life of Mr Ulric Cross (2021)
programme.desc: Drama documentary telling the story of Trinidad-born Ulric Cross, who became the RAF's most decorated West Indian airman of the Second World War. He went on to become a presenter with the BBC, before acting as a go-between for several African countries in their struggles against imperialism during the 1950s and 1960s

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell, after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Plus, the programme revisits a pledge made in 2018 by then-local government minister Rishi Sunak to keep private parking companies in check

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A police officer's instinct leads to armed robbers being caught in the act and a dangerous driver turns out to be a big-time drug dealer

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers take on new challenges in Reduce Reuse Recycle week, starting with making a pair of trousers with zero-waste before tackling a mountain of wasted tote bags in the Transformation Challenge. For a Made to Measure outfit, the sewers have been asked to source second-hand crochet blankets

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: Coniston Water isn't the biggest of Cumbria's lakes - but it's one of the most iconic and the place where Donald Campbell died trying to break the world water speed record. Paul meets Campbell's daughter Gina and crew member Robbie Robinson, who was there on the fateful day in January 1967 when Bluebird somersaulted and crashed on the water. The explorer also enters a Lakeland bike ride with a difference before ending his visit with a spot of rock climbing at Dow Crag before the ascent of one of the area's best known hills, The Old Man of Coniston

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine to Scotland, where it becomes the first vehicle of its kind to cross the Forth Road Bridge under its own steam. He also visits the Falkirk Wheel and one of the region's few surviving traditional ironworks

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: Historian Janina Ramirez and art critic Alastair Sooke embark on cultural city breaks, offering insights into the most famous locations and uncovering hidden gems and untold stories to reveal how religion, revolution and trailblazing individuals can shape the art - and soul - of a metropolis. They begin by examining the art and design of the Dutch capital Amsterdam, along the way discovering how its culture reflects the liberal attitudes, appetite for global trade and love of home comforts that helped shape the character of this city

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: First of a four-part series documenting the experiences of Caribbean immigrants to the UK, beginning with the arrival of the troop ship Empire Windrush on June 22, 1948 carrying 500 West Indians. Britain's first taste of mass immigration this century was soured by racial hostility which escalated in the years to come, culminating in the notorious Nottingham and Notting Hill riots of 1958

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: The 1958 Notting Hill riots and Britain's first racial murder appeared to predict a bleak future for the immigrants who arrived on the Windrush. Archive footage reveals how, in the face of adversity, black communities and churches sprang up across the country, offering new hope to those starting their lives afresh - until Enoch Powell's infamous Rivers of Blood speech in 1968 looked set to wreck their efforts

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: The examination of immigration of Caribbeans to Britain continues with a look at the race riots of the 1970s, and the dilemma faced by children of early migrants over whether to define themselves as British

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: The series charting the fate of immigrants to Britain ends on an optimistic note with an overview of success stories for black people in politics, media and sport. Leading lights of Anglo-African culture, including Valerie Amos, Lenny Henry and Soul II Soul's Jazzie B, analyse how the country's mood has changed over the past 60 years from hostility to acceptance

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Clive Lloyd, former West Indies cricket captain, looks at the life of Learie Constantine, the Trinidad-born cricketer who fought against injustice and discrimination

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Jamaican-born Carlton Duncan, who arrived in Britain in 1961 and achieved fame in the dance world before embarking on a teaching career, finally becoming the UK's first black secondary school headmaster in 1982

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: A profile of Brenda Edwards, who won a place at the London School of Contemporary Dance at 17 and became artistic director of London Festival Ballet. She later returned to her contemporary roots, becoming a teacher and choreographer

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: Coniston Water isn't the biggest of Cumbria's lakes - but it's one of the most iconic and the place where Donald Campbell died trying to break the world water speed record. Paul meets Campbell's daughter Gina and crew member Robbie Robinson, who was there on the fateful day in January 1967 when Bluebird somersaulted and crashed on the water. The explorer also enters a Lakeland bike ride with a difference before ending his visit with a spot of rock climbing at Dow Crag before the ascent of one of the area's best known hills, The Old Man of Coniston

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine to Scotland, where it becomes the first vehicle of its kind to cross the Forth Road Bridge under its own steam. He also visits the Falkirk Wheel and one of the region's few surviving traditional ironworks

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: Historian Janina Ramirez and art critic Alastair Sooke embark on cultural city breaks, offering insights into the most famous locations and uncovering hidden gems and untold stories to reveal how religion, revolution and trailblazing individuals can shape the art - and soul - of a metropolis. They begin by examining the art and design of the Dutch capital Amsterdam, along the way discovering how its culture reflects the liberal attitudes, appetite for global trade and love of home comforts that helped shape the character of this city

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: Remote Eskdale is the next destination in the explorer's trek through the Lake District, enjoying the landscapes and meeting its people. The corner of the western Lakes he focuses on is off the normal tourist track, yet boasts England's highest mountain. However, before making the tough climb to the summit of Scafell Pike, Paul meets the folk who run one of the country's most scenic railways, has a close encounter with a vulture, and gets to grips with the locals in a spot of Cumberland wrestling

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack's journey takes him to the North East, where he visits a pumping station that ran for 100 years before ceasing operation in 1967 and travels across the Middlesbrough Transporter Bridge. He also discovers a company in Bradford which still makes boilers in the old-fashioned way, with rivets instead of welding

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Driven to desperation by his sixth cold of the winter, Hancock tries various cures including a visit to a local witch and a keep-fit course

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: The ever-optimistic Bob tries to broaden Terry's social circle by inviting him to a trendy dinner party, but as usual his well-meaning efforts result in disaster. Rodney Bewes and James Bolam star as the original men behaving badly

programme.title: Una Marson: Our Lost Caribbean Voice
programme.desc: Docudrama telling the extraordinary story of the trailblazing Jamaican poet, playwright and campaigner, who became the BBC's first black producer and broadcaster. Joining the BBC's Empire Service during the Second World War, she gave voice to Caribbean writers and intellectuals and brought their stories and culture to a global audience accustomed to hearing only English accents. Una played by Seroca Davis

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The transformation of docks across the UK, many of which have changed from commercial ports to the world into clean, contemporary hubs for leisure and the arts. Narrated by Sue Johnston

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins the South African artist William Kentridge as he prepares an epic frieze along the banks of the river Tiber in Rome. The presenter visits him in his hometown of Johannesburg, the inspiration for the magical hand-drawn animated films he calls Drawings for Projection. Brought up under Apartheid, Kentridge has witnessed the fragile transition to a multi-racial democracy and his art continues to reflect South Africa's turbulent times

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Edric Connor came to England in 1944 and took a job with the World Service. In 1958, he became the first black actor to appear with the Royal Shakespeare Company

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Profile of Jamaican-born Gloria Cumper, who became the first black female law graduate of Girton College, Cambridge, in 1947, and pursued a distinguished career as legislator and founder of the University of the West Indies

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Tailor Andrew Ramroop shares the story of his success, from a penniless student at the London School of Fashion to co-owner of a successful business in the heart of the capital's fashion district, Savile Row

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which adventurer Paul Rose explores the 79 miles of the Yorkshire Wolds Way, one of Britain's least well-known national walking trails. The trail starts at the Humber Estuary and ends at the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Filey. On the way, Paul takes in the views from the top of the Humber Bridge, learns to ride a penny farthing and searches out the spots made internationally famous by the artist David Hockney

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack fulfils a personal ambition by driving his traction engine across the Scammonden Bridge near Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. He also visits a forge in Sheffield and watches crucible steel being made by the experts at Abbeydale Industrial Hamlet

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: The mountains and forests of northern Thailand, an area that is home to a variety of wildlife, leading to unusual partnerships developing between animals and people. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Lenny Henry's Caribbean Britain
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lenny looks back on his coming of age and explores how he and other second and third generation, British-born Caribbean children began to mesh their identity into their art. From the theatre and arts collectives of the 1980s, to the making of brands, to the evolution of jungle and grime music, he explores how the output of successive generations has moved into the mainstream, enriching and transforming Britain's cultural offering

programme.title: Stephen Poliakoff Remembers - She's Been Away
programme.desc: The writer looks back at his 1989 drama, which was directed by Peter Hall and featured the final appearance of Peggy Ashcroft

programme.title: She's Been Away
programme.desc: An elderly woman recently discharged from a mental hospital after 60 years is reluctantly taken in by relatives and forges an unlikely bond with her nephew's pregnant wife - little realising the ill effects it will have on the family. Drama, starring Peggy Ashcroft, Geraldine James, Rachel Kempson and James Fox

programme.title: South Africa in Pictures
programme.desc: British photographer Rankin, whose subjects have included Britney Spears, Kylie Minogue, Damien Hirst and the Queen, turns his focus on South Africa. He explores the country's rich history on film, and discovers the role the art has played in recording the story of its people. Includes contributions by war reporters the Bang Bang Club and photographers David Goldblatt and Alf Kumalo

programme.desc: Febo's family are from America, where they celebrate Thanksgiving. As it is traditional on Thanksgiving to prepare and serve pumpkin pie as a dessert, Febo is making this for his friends. He starts by making a pastry case and fitting it into a pie dish. For the pumpkin filling: he pours melted butter and buttermilk into a bowl of brown sugar, along with whisked egg, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice and cloves. Febo adds his special ingredient, pumpkin puree, and then mixes them all together. When it's mixed, he spoons it into the empty pastry case and puts it in the oven to cook. Febo's friends all help to decorate his American-themed table before they taste his pumpkin pie.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Sebastiaan's making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monsters small kite doesnt seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team mark National Windrush Day by restoring items that celebrate the Windrush generation. Beverley comes into the barn with a British passport issued to her father in Jamaica in 1948 which served as his legally binding document to come to the UK to help rebuild after the Second World War. Keithly brings in a suitcase used by his mother that holds memories of her journey from the island of Nevis to the UK in 1956. Brother and sister duo Dorcas and Stephan bring a precious clock for the attention of horologist Steven Fletcher, it being the first item their parents Hermann and Keturah saved up to buy after arriving in the UK from Antigua. Patrick Vernon OBE brings with him his British-Jamaican Second World War veteran father's radiogram for repair

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.desc: Samantha Poling investigates the companies that deal in debt. With the cost of living crisis hitting hard, more and more people are struggling to pay what they owe. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at the growth of paramilitary organisations in the early 1970s, with killings, explosions, intimidation and street disorder becoming widespread - with devastating and often lasting effects. programme.desc: Phil ropes Ritchie in to dig up dirt on George's missing wife and Suki convinces Nish they need to sack Eve. Keanu realises Finlay's car was deliberately damaged and Ben backtracks on having Lexi live with him

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team mark National Windrush Day by restoring items that celebrate the Windrush generation. Beverley comes into the barn with a British passport issued to her father in Jamaica in 1948 which served as his legally binding document to come to the UK to help rebuild after the Second World War. Keithly brings in a suitcase used by his mother that holds memories of her journey from the island of Nevis to the UK in 1956. Brother and sister duo Dorcas and Stephan bring a precious clock for the attention of horologist Steven Fletcher, it being the first item their parents Hermann and Keturah saved up to buy after arriving in the UK from Antigua. Patrick Vernon OBE brings with him his British-Jamaican Second World War veteran father's radiogram for repair

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Hooded Men - Britain's Torture Playbook
programme.desc: In 1971, 14 men were tortured by the British state in Northern Ireland. For 50 years they fought for the truth, and now they want the Government to apologise. This film reveals the full horror of one of the darkest episodes in British intelligence history through intimate first hand testimony, including access to their legal battle for their treatment to be recognised as torture in the UK's Supreme Court, interviews with senior members of the British security forces, and declassified government documents

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: The gang try to pinpoint where it all started and what went wrong. Georgia spies an opportunity as both David and Michael worry the other prefers working alone

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael try to break the standstill on the project while Simon tries becoming a dentist after giving up writing. Georgia's efforts turn manipulative

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.desc: In November 2006, DI Brent Hyatt and DS Jim Dawson are summoned to University College Hospital in London to interview Alexander Litvinenko, a former Russian spy who claims to have been poisoned. His wife Marina tells the detectives that doctors are sceptical of his story, though his deteriorating physical condition is clear for everyone to see. Litvinenko provides a meticulous account of who he believes to have killed him, and also the man responsible for ordering his murder, none other than Vladimir Putin. Fact-based drama, starring David Tennant

His wife Marina tells the detectives that doctors are sceptical of his story, though his deteriorating physical condition is clear for everyone to see. Litvinenko provides a meticulous account of who he believes to have killed him, and also the man responsible for ordering his murder, none other than Vladimir Putin. programme.desc: Hippies colonise Lawson's holiday cottages, causing much local dissent and tut-tutting. programme.desc: Laurel leads Ashley astray in the Woolpack, but his boozy behaviour doesn't go unnoticed. Daz strives to impress a resentful Andy, and Frances leaves for Hull - will Elaine and Alistair go with her?

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As England and Argentina kick off in the World Cup quarter-final, Oxford's streets are deserted. At an almost empty museum, Adrian Weiss, a specialist in heraldry and genealogy, is found dead - slain by a ceremonial dagger with links to 19th-century India. An entry in the visitors' book leads Morse to a girls' boarding school, where a note reading 'Save Me' is mysteriously slipped into his coat pocket. Digging into the building's troubled history, he finds a connection between Weiss's untimely fate and a series of unsolved murders that occurred on the school's grounds almost 100 years earlier. 1960s-set drama, starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, James Bradshaw and Abigail Thaw

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The evacuation of a central London hospital leads to the discovery of a tragic death. When Brooks and Devlin investigate, a suspect is arrested but the prosecutors (Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman) face an uphill struggle building a case - so they team up with the detectives in a bid to gather more evidence. Patrick Malahide and Bill Paterson co-star

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: DCI Mike Braithwaite reinvestigates the murder of 16-year-old schoolboy Matthew Taylor in the Lake District five years previously when the teacher convicted of killing him is found not guilty on appeal and released from prison. The return of the crime drama, starring Shaun Dooley, with Katherine Kelly and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis

Meanwhile, Alan and Tony agree to pick up a package for Greengrass, only to discover it's actually a coffin allegedly containing the body of his sister. Medical drama, starring Julian Ovenden, Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Amy Robbins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The medics discover a newborn baby abandoned in the grounds, and soon suspect the child may be linked to a missing teenager. Dr Weatherill goes to great lengths to help an elderly couple and a Russian sailor is admitted with acute appendicitis, which presents Greengrass with what appears to be a great moneymaking scheme. Medical drama, starring Julian Ovenden, Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Tricia's world comes crashing down as Marlon tells her what went on while she was away. Laurel withdraws from Ashley, leaving him in a spin, and the Dingles plan Christmas courtesy of the Tates

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon pleads with Tricia not to end their marriage, Laurel strives to forget about Ashley, Chastity receives an irritating phone call and the Dingles fine-tune the details of their robbery

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: It's Joe's last day at the factory, but a goodbye drink with Mike prompts him to question whether he's doing the right thing. Martin catches Sarah and Todd up to no good in the bedroom, and Fiz lets Maria know she's public enemy number one

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: It's all change at Underworld as Joe sacks Hayley and offers Karen the supervisor's job - how will Steve feel about his wife working so closely with her boss? Sarah and Todd finally come clean to Gail about sleeping together, and Sunita offers to take Ciaran in, unaware he's on the run from the Navy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Schoolgirl Jennifer Sutcliffe becomes embroiled in a mystery when priceless jewels are hidden among her belongings. The precious stones once belonged to a prince who fell foul of a revolution, and now his cousin is a pupil at the same school as Jennifer, where Poirot finds himself drawn into the unlikely situation and realises nothing is quite what it seems. David Suchet stars as the Belgian sleuth, with Harriet Walter and Claire Skinner

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly patient's sudden death prompts a series of revelations about his decidedly shady past - and the raid he was planning on Ashfordly Bank. Meanwhile, Craddock is offered the chance of promotion, and Vernon embarks on yet another venture - Scripps' Roaming Holidays. Nostalgic drama, starring Philip Franks, Jason Durr and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: New sergeant Dennis Merton arrives at Ashfordly police station and soon finds himself embroiled in a CID stakeout - but Ventress's shady past threatens the entire operation. Meanwhile, all efforts to pummel David into the peak of physical fitness look set to come to nothing, until a chance encounter knocks Vernon for six. Nostalgic drama, starring William Simons and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The body of farmer Alex Preston is found in the middle of the sacred Crowcall stone circle in Midsomer Mow, with new medical examiner Dr Kate Wilding confirming that the victim was disembowelled but that a head injury was the likely cause of death. Suspicion initially falls on local druids led by high priests Ezra Canning and Leticia Clifford, since Preston's plans to plough Gorse Meadow would have barred their access to the site. Barnaby and Jones are joined by Wilding to investigate, and as the case wears on, the inspector becomes convinced greed rather than spiritualism is the motive. Starring Neil Dudgeon, Jason Hughes and Tamzin Malleson

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin fail to find a lead when a 13-year-old is kicked to death at Euston Station, so they turn to Chandler, who holds a press conference. As the detectives are led through a tangled web of family loyalties, the suspect's barrister, an old flame of Steel's, gathers evidence for an audacious defence strategy that could change the nature of the British legal system. Dervla Kirwan guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: As Sally begins a confident return to work, the police question Anna Stamp as they attempt to uncover what it is she is hiding, and more importantly what are Matthew's parents covering up? Karen grows increasingly paranoid over Sally and Sam. Starring Katherine Kelly, Jamie Bamber and Shaun Dooley

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Called to investigate the murder of a brewery manager, Morse delves into the history of the generations-old family firm and discovers that several employees and shareholders stood to profit from the victim's death. The challenge facing him is to discern whether any of them would stoop to foul play. Guest starring Lionel Jeffries and John Bird

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch is left devastated by news that the hospital is facing closure, and Ormerod finds romance in an unexpected place. A patient who claims to be suffering from amnesia sparks suspicions and Dr Cheriton's housewarming party leads to an unexpected display of passion. Medical drama, starring Julian Ovenden, Ian Carmichael, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zak forces Cain and Charity to call a truce, and Terry is nervous about leaving hospital - much to Dawn's chagrin. Marlon makes a breakthrough with Tricia, while Chastity welcomes her son Aaron to the village

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Karen risks alienating all her friends when she takes the heavy-handed approach on her first day as factory supervisor. programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The factory girls give Karen the silent treatment following the bust-up - so she reacts by threatening to sack Janice, which doesn't go down too well with Mike. Peter offers to help Shelley with the wedding plans - but changes his mind when she talks about getting the flowers from Lucy's shop

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective's friend Sir Charles Cartwright (guest star Martin Shaw) hosts a cocktail party at his home in Cornwall, where an amiable local priest chokes to death on his drink. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victim's glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charles's doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress has his work cut out as a series of crimes linked to an old farming feud turns deadly. But when the evidence fails to add up it is up to the bobbies to prove who is responsible before someone gets killed. Meanwhile, Vernon is inspired to screen films in the village hall. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons, Tricia Penrose and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious visitor is suspected of involvement in the theft of a priceless Ming vase. Mike tries to discover the reason for Merton's visit to headquarters and Gina starts acting like Aidensfield's answer to Mata Hari. Nostalgic drama, guest starring Leslie Grantham

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A college dean is found bludgeoned to death in local woodland, following a heated pub debate. When an alchemic image is discovered by the body, denoting the first of four stages of a process called 'The Magnum Opus', the detectives realise that there are three more murders to follow. Before any more crimes are committed, the team must uncover the guilty secret that the victims share in order to learn the identity of the killer and the potential victims

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A former vice cop is found beaten to death, setting Brooks and Devlin off on an investigation through London's seedy underbelly. The victim's widow and his former boss both seem to know more about the murder than they are letting on - but the trail eventually leads to a respectable children's clothes shop. Crime drama, with guest appearances by Sean Pertwee (Cold Feet), Lesley Manville (Cranford) and Juliet Aubrey (Primeval)

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: As Sally and Sam grow closer, the police investigation turns to Gary Walker, but what is his connection? Meanwhile, Bethany's link to Matthew comes to light as Karen admits a damning secret. Starring Katherine Kelly, Jamie Bamber and Shaun Dooley

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Ghosts from the past return to haunt Morse as he investigates the apparent suicide of a terminally ill Oxford don whose widow turns out to be the woman the detective was set to marry in his youth. As the case develops, Lewis worries his partner's professionalism is being undermined. Starring John Thaw and Kevin Whately, with Joanna David, Samantha Bond, David Haig, Adrian Dunbar and James Grout

programme.title: Frasier

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A caller to his radio show gives Frasier the impression Niles's wife Maris might be having an affair with her fencing instructor. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Lincolnshire to meet mangle collector Colin, who's trying to find a home for his late father's possessions, including a motorbike won in a raffle

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants from in and around Glasgow compete for the cash prize of 1,000. Mandi and Ally kick off proceedings with some family favourites, including some Scottish charcuterie. Next, Judith and Charlene host an evening full of revelations, while on the final day, Lucy and Stephen risk it all with an exotic menu inspired by Lucy's travels to Asia

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes headlines and weather

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game with Marcus Brigstocke joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is with house-hunter Marion in the coastal region of Puglia in the south of Italy, helping her buy a holiday home she can enjoy with her daughter, friends and family

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Lee Juggurnauth helps Sarah and Justin locate a suitable a holiday home on Greece's south-west Peloponnese peninsula. The couple met 35 years ago on the beach in Greece, and now with two grown-up daughters, think it's time to buy a property there. They have a budget of 320,000 to work within, so Lee sorts out a number of options for them to consider

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Dave and Lynn are making progress on their farmhouse renovations and Susie and Bill start making plans for their garden

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer's computing error plunges Earth into chaos as an electronic apocalypse threatens Springfield, and Bart and Lisa save Xena the Warrior Princess from a super-villain. Meanwhile, the Simpsons attempt to cover up their accidental murder of Ned Flanders, but he refuses to stay dead. With the guest voices of Lucy Lawless, Tom Arnold and Dick Clark

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ethan is desperate to get Warren off his back and to have the dream life him and Sienna are planning, while Dave returns home still drunk in the morning

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with former house-hunters who were looking for a new start. In 2012, Kirsten and Scott moved from Kirkcaldy after Scott was made redundant and secured a new job in Aberdeen. Kirstie managed to find them a rural cottage close to Scott's work. Nine years, several moves and a few job changes later, the pair are back in Kirkcaldy where Kirstie catches up with them. In 2020, Digi had a big budget and even bigger expectations. She was looking for a country pile near London with outbuildings for both her businesses that was close to daughter Emily's school and full of character. Having a medical condition meant her new home also had to be fully accessible. Kirstie rose to the challenge but Digi realised if she wanted to find the perfect property she would have to expand her search. Two years later, Phil visits Digi in her new home in Abingdon to see if she managed to find her dream place

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English border staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: The Change
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bridget Christie. When 50-year-old mother of two, Linda is told what she thought was early onset dementia is actually menopause, she decides to do something for herself for a change and reconnect with the person that she used to be

programme.title: The Change
programme.desc: Linda's tranquil journey into the forest in search for a time capsule she hid there as a child is interrupted by Pig Man, a recluse who lives in the woods with only wild boar for company

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Matre d' Fred Sirieix and his team prepare once again to play Cupid at their Manchester restaurant. Essex-born cleaning fanatic Fleur is paired with Essex boy Louis, who reveals he has been working as a high-end escort. Thirty five-year-old Ian, from Co Durham, is full of contradictions, which include working as a gas fitter while also running an art gallery with a champagne bar. it remains to be seen if similarly-aged medical lab assistant Michaela could be the woman to love all of his quirks

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow junior doctor Ming, who for the first time in his career carries out a needle aspiration on a 19-year-old patient brought into A&E with a collapsed lung. A woman who is 17 weeks pregnant falls down the stairs, and fears the accident may lead to a possible miscarriage. She recounts her struggles to conceive, and fears that if this pregnancy fails, she may never have a child

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man with a deep cut to the head refuses to go to hospital for fear that he won't come out again. It's not often the paramedics treat a patient who runs off, but that's what happens when they're called to a suspected drug overdose. A homeless man is in agony with spasms in his back, and a 12-year-old girl with epilepsy has a seizure, but her mother still wants her to go to school

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Brick Hotel in Newtown, Pennsylvania, where the staff have had enough of owner Verindar, who runs the establishment like an angry tyrant. Can Gordon convince her to value her loyal workers and entice customers back to this landmark hotel?

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In West Yorkshire, Stacey and Tom kick things off with a traditional European menu, with Stacey forced to confront her fears and handle chicken livers for the first time. Robin and wife Kaz steal the night with terrible jokes and comedy false teeth, while bemused Kiwi couple Leigh and Toni wonder at some of the humour. The second day sees Leigh and Toni preparing their Italian-themed menu in the tiny galley of their barge, but the biggest worry is the rabbit main course. Finally Robin and Kaz host, confident the meaty menu they have in mind will be a winner, along with their planned conga
